data.question: What is the chemical formula of the MOF-SCO studied in this work?
data.answer: The MOF-SCO studied has the chemical formula [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] 路 2BzCHO, where tvp = trans(4,4-vinylenedipyridine) and BzCHO = benzaldehyde.

data.question: What are the two main control parameters that usually induce phase transitions in MOFs?
data.answer: Temperature and pressure are the most common control parameters that induce phase transitions in MOFs.

data.question: What is the spin state of the Fe atoms in the [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] MOF when no guest molecules are present?
data.answer: When no guest molecules are present, the Fe atoms in [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] remain in the high-spin (HS) state down to low temperatures.

data.question: What experimental techniques were used to characterize the different structural phases of the MOF-SCO?
data.answer: Synchrotron x-ray diffraction was used to characterize the long-range order and symmetry lowering as a function of temperature. Complementary laboratory x-ray diffraction measurements were also performed.

data.question: What computational methods were used to explore the structure of the guest molecules confined within the MOF-SCO?
data.answer: Molecular dynamics (MD) simulations were carried out to explore the structure of the benzaldehyde guest molecules confined within the MOF-SCO. Initial configurations were generated using Monte Carlo simulations in the grand canonical ensemble.

data.question: What spectroscopic technique was used to selectively study the vibrational properties of the high-spin and low-spin species?
data.answer: Raman spectroscopy was performed to selectively study the vibrational properties of the high-spin and low-spin species in the MOF-SCO.

data.question: How does the inclusion of benzaldehyde guest molecules affect the spin-crossover behavior of the [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] MOF?
data.answer: The inclusion of benzaldehyde guest molecules induces a spin-crossover from the high-spin to low-spin state in the [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] MOF, which does not occur in the guest-free MOF. This spin-crossover involves a complex sequence of intermediate phases with different symmetries.

data.question: What is the relationship between the anomalous temperature dependence of the c lattice parameter and the softening of the Raman mode associated with the squeezing of the tvp ligand?
data.answer: The anomalous increase of the c lattice parameter between the two phase transitions at Tc1 and Tc2 is correlated with the softening of the Raman mode associated with the squeezing of the tvp ligand in the same temperature range. This suggests the tvp ligands interact with the guest molecules through hydrogen bonds, which affects both the structure and vibrational properties.

data.question: How do the radial distribution functions from MD simulations provide insight into the arrangement of the benzaldehyde guest molecules within the MOF-SCO?
data.answer: The radial distribution functions between the centers of mass of the benzaldehyde molecules show the guests adopt a sandwich conformation favoring 蟺-蟺 interactions. The first peak is at a shorter distance in the MOF compared to the bulk phase, indicating the size and shape of the MOF channels forces the molecules into this conformation. The radial distribution functions between the oxygen and hydrogen atoms of the guest molecules also reveal hydrogen bonding interactions between the guests along the channel direction.

data.question: What is the proposed explanation for the plateau observed at xHS = 1/4 in the thermal spin conversion of the low symmetry phase III?
data.answer: The plateau at xHS = 1/4 in the low symmetry phase III can be explained by the formation of a periodic spin-state concentration wave during the spin-crossover. The symmetry breaking generates inequivalent Fe sites that allows for long-range ordering of high-spin and low-spin states in a pattern compatible with the 1/4 high-spin fraction.

data.question: Why was density functional theory (DFT) used in this study?
data.answer: DFT calculations were used to obtain the vibrational mode frequencies of a molecular model of the [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] MOF in order to interpret the experimental Raman data and identify the relevant modes. DFT allowed calculating the modes separately for the high-spin and low-spin states.

data.question: What is the role of host-guest and guest-guest interactions in the observed structural and spin-crossover behavior of the [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] 路 2BzCHO system?
data.answer: The host-guest and guest-guest interactions, in particular hydrogen bonding, play an essential role in the symmetry breaking phase transitions and spin-crossover behavior. MD simulations show the benzaldehyde guests form hydrogen bonds with the MOF framework as well as between each other along the channels. These interactions, combined with confinement effects, determine the guest arrangement. The anomalous structural changes and Raman mode softening also indicate the importance of host-guest coupling. Therefore, the guest molecules mediate the phase transitions and spin-state ordering in the material.

data.question: What is the space group of the high symmetry phase I of [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] 路 2BzCHO?
data.answer: The space group of the high symmetry phase I is P4/n 21/c 2/c.

data.question: What is the nature of the phase transition from the tetragonal phase II to the orthorhombic phase III?
data.answer: The phase transition from the tetragonal phase II to the orthorhombic phase III is of ferroelastic nature.

data.question: True or false: The spin-crossover in [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] 路 2BzCHO is associated with a change in the magnetic susceptibility, electronic absorption, and vibrational spectra of the material.
True or false: The guest benzaldehyde molecules could be fully resolved in the crystal structure from x-ray diffraction at all temperatures.
data.answer: False. The guest molecules remain disordered in the structure at all temperatures studied, and could not be fully resolved from the x-ray diffraction data.

data.question: True or false: The spin-crossover in [Fe(tvp)2(NCS)2] 路 2BzCHO occurs in a single step without any intermediate phases.
data.answer: False. The spin-crossover occurs through a complex sequence of intermediate phases with different symmetries involving spin-state ordering, ligand ordering, and guest ordering.

data.question: True or false: The Fe-N bond lengths are longer in the high-spin state compared to the low-spin state.
True or false: Molecular dynamics simulations show the benzaldehyde guest molecules adopt a stacked conformation within the MOF channels.
True or false: The phase transition temperatures Tc1 and Tc2 correspond to clear anomalies in the magnetic susceptibility data.
data.answer: False. The phase transition temperatures Tc1 and Tc2 determined from x-ray diffraction do not correspond to any anomalies in the magnetic susceptibility curve.

data.question: True or false: Raman spectroscopy provides a way to selectively study the vibrational modes of the high-spin and low-spin species because their spectral signatures are significantly different.
